intro: Haukia crotalophoroides, commonly known as the slender crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features slender, erect stems with alternate, pinnately compound leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive spurred petal, and it produces small, woody pods containing seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
